meanings.definition: A type of acrobatic movement involving a complete forward or backward revolution of the body.
meanings.sent1: During the circus show, the performer executed a perfect somerset in mid-air.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast practiced her somerset on the mat to improve her skills.
meanings.sent3: The somerset by the acrobat left the audience in awe of his agility.
meanings.sent4: Her somerset across the stage was like a graceful dance in the air.
meanings.sent5: The somerset, with its twist and turn, was the highlight of the performance.

meanings.sent1: She decided to somerset off the diving board into the pool.
meanings.sent2: The children love to somerset in the park, showing off their flips.
meanings.sent3: He tried to somerset but ended up landing on his back instead.
meanings.sent4: The cat seemed to somerset effortlessly from the couch to the floor.
meanings.sent5: In the competition, the gymnast will somerset to impress the judges.

meanings.sent1: Visiting Somerset in England was a delightful experience for the tourists.
meanings.sent2: The historical buildings in Somerset attract many visitors each year.
meanings.sent3: The residents of Somerset enjoy the peaceful atmosphere of their town.
meanings.sent4: Driving through Somerset felt like a journey back in time with its charming streets.
meanings.sent5: The local market in Somerset bustled with activity on weekends.
